poem:
Sonata of Silence

Endless fingers play
between black and white,
Maria whispers rebellion,
notes striking in hidden rooms.
Shostakovich hears the echoes,
Mandelstam hums the shadows,
Pasternak scribbles prayers
on sheets of forbidden scores.
The keys are locked,
but her music,
opens the doors.
